thread.title: Frank Lampard takes on Alan Shearer in penalty shootout against David Seaman - and one of them drops a CLANGER
thread.title_full: Frank Lampard takes on Alan Shearer in penalty shootout against David Seaman - and one of them drops a CLANGER

author: Jake Polden
title: Frank Lampard takes on Alan Shearer in penalty shootout against David Seaman - and one of them drops a CLANGER
text:
When you think of Frank Lampard and Alan Shearer you think of goals. 
The two were prolific for their respective Premier League teams and both enjoyed successful careers at the top of the game. 
These days the retired duo apparently live life at a slower pace. Well, until a football challenge is put in front of them, that is. 
The former England internationals were guests on Play to the Whistle, which was broadcast on ITV last night. Oh Alan Shearer, what have you done? (Photo: ITV) 
And well, with the duo on the show, the producers were hardly going to miss the opportunity to pit them against each other now, were they? 
A penalty shootout was the challenge selected, but who would go in goal? Well, audience member David Seaman, of course. Frank Lampard hasn't lost it (Photo: ITV) 
Fortunately for everyone who was lucky enough to be at the recording of the show, the former Arsenal shot-stopper just happened to be in the audience! What are the chances? 
He took his place between the goal posts and pulled his gloves on in preparation of the pair firing balls at him. The former Chelsea man has scored more penalties for England than anyone else (Photo: Reuters) 
As show host Holly Willoughby pointed out ahead of the game, Lampard has scored the most penalties for England, Shearer has netted more in the Premier League and Seaman has won a shoot-out in goal for the national team - by far the most impressive stat there. 
So the challenge was expected to be a good one... Shearer was prolific in front of goal for Newcastle (Photo: Getty) 
Shearer was first up, and well, probably wished he hadn't bothered agreeing to come on the show, before Lampard stepped up to the plate and delivered. 
Seaman then saved Shearer's second spot-kick, after his first attempt went miles wide, before the former Chelsea man found the back of the net again. 
Who would have thought it, eh? Like us on Facebook
